nodes.bodyText:
I changed this, because the returned workbasket could contain a wrong id.
This happens in the case of an workbasket with existing key-domain-value but wrong id.
In this case the id should also be removed because the backend doesn't check this properly.
This piece of code was called that often so I refactored it to an simple method

the imortant part is that a rest call is simulated here. "getXX" is a bit confusing.
Please rename this to something more meaningful.
this test is to avoid the problems Holger had - it imports every workbasket in domain A seperately
this is to define a distribution target within the import-file
this check was always done after the importRequest-function - so I added it internally.

Should I also fix this test?
When the same Id is given twice to different workbaskets then a link in the distribution targets to this id is ambigious.
(for example: {wb1: ID1, key1, domain1}, {wb2: ID1, key2, domain1}, {wb3: IDx,..., distributionTargets:[ID1]} - which workbasket is the distribution target?)
At the moment the distribution target would only be linked to the last workbasket which uses the id.
This cannot be the expected behaviour.
We could link the distribution target to all workbaskets with the same Id.
In my opinion it's less confusing when we just deny this case.
ID and key/domain are both unique identifiers for one workbasket. The case you decribe is invalid. Maybe this was a misunderstanding. Do you have the time to fix this?
